alert.note: Alert for Divide; Williams (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:42PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN WILLIAMS AND CENTRAL DIVIDE COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM CDT... At 540 PM CDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles north of Crosby to 8 miles west of Alamo to 5 miles northwest of Bonetrail. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Crosby around 545 PM CDT. Alamo around 600 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Noonan and Wildrose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern North Dakota.
